intro: Thibaudia macrantha, commonly known as the large-flowered thibaudia, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. Its leaves are typically large, heart-shaped, and have a velvety texture. Thibaudia macrantha is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its striking floral display and adaptability to various soil types.
